VEC.Q: How many labels are in this radar chart?
How many dimensions are in this radar chart?

SRP.Q: In the radar chart, what is the next dimension in the clockwise direction from Fuel Cost as Rate of Revenue?
SRP.A: The next dimension clockwise from Fuel Cost as Rate of Revenue is Damage/Loss Rate

SRP.Q: In the radar chart, what is the next dimension in the counterclockwise direction from Fuel Cost as Rate of Revenue?
SRP.A: The next dimension counterclockwise from Fuel Cost as Rate of Revenue is Route Efficiency .

SRP.Q: On the Route Efficiency , is the point for Thompson, Hall and Bell inside or outside the point for Dawson, Jones and Ball?
SRP.A: On the Route Efficiency , the point for Thompson, Hall and Bell is outside the point for Dawson, Jones and Ball.

VPR.Q: Which label encloses the largest score in the radar chart?
VPR.A: label {Vehicle Utilization Rate} encloses the largest score

VPR.Q: What are the strongest and weakest dimension of Thompson, Hall and Bell?
VPR.A: The strongest aspect is {Vehicle Utilization Rate}, while the weakest aspect is{ Damage/Loss Rate }.

VPR.Q: On dimension Route Efficiency , which label scores the highest?
VPR.A: On Route Efficiency , label {Dawson, Jones and Ball} scores the highest.

VPR.Q: On dimension Route Optimization Efficiency, which label scores the highest?
VPR.A: On Route Optimization Efficiency, label {Aguilar-Price} scores the lowest.

VE.Q: What is the value of Aguilar-Price on the Route Efficiency  in the radar chart?
VE.A: The value of Aguilar-Price on the Safety dimension is {70}.

VE.Q: What is the value of Dawson, Jones and Ball on the Route Optimization Efficiency in the radar chart?
VE.A: The value of Dawson, Jones and Ball on the Safety dimension is {96}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum value of label Dawson, Jones and Ball across all dimensions in the radar chart?
EVJ.A: The maximum value of Dawson, Jones and Ball across all dimensions is {53}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum value of label Thompson, Hall and Bell across all dimensions in the radar chart?
EVJ.A: The minimum value of Thompson, Hall and Bell across all dimensions is {96}.

SC.A: The average value of Vehicle Utilization Rate is {90.67}.

SC.Q: What is the difference in Route Efficiency  between Thompson, Hall and Bell and Dawson, Jones and Ball?

NC.Q: For Thompson, Hall and Bell, which dimension has a higher score: Damage/Loss Rate  or Vehicle Utilization Rate?
NC.A: {Vehicle Utilization Rate} has a higher score than Damage/Loss Rate  for Thompson, Hall and Bell.

NC.Q: For Dawson, Jones and Ball, which dimension has a higher score: Route Optimization Efficiency or Fuel Cost as Rate of Revenue?
NC.A: {Route Optimization Efficiency} has a higher score than Fuel Cost as Rate of Revenue for Dawson, Jones and Ball.

NC.Q: On Damage/Loss Rate , which label has a higher score: Dawson, Jones and Ball or the Thompson, Hall and Bell?
NC.A: {Dawson, Jones and Ball} has a higher score on Damage/Loss Rate  compared to Thompson, Hall and Bell.

NC.Q: For Thompson, Hall and Bell, which dimension has a higher score: Fuel Cost as Rate of Revenue or Vehicle Utilization Rate or Damage/Loss Rate ?
NC.A: {Vehicle Utilization Rate} has a higher score for Thompson, Hall and Bell.

MSR.Q: For Thompson, Hall and Bell, based on the data shown in the radar chart, which dimension does it most need to improve?
MSR.A: Thompson, Hall and Bell most needs to improve its {Damage/Loss Rate }.

MSR.Q: In the radar chart, which label has the strongest overall capability across all labels?
MSR.A: The label with the strongest overall capability is {Dawson, Jones and Ball}.

MSR.Q: In the radar chart, which label has the weaknest overall capability across all labels?
MSR.A: The label with the weaknest overall capability is {Thompson, Hall and Bell}.
